**Question 1:** Create a function `CountRowProds()` that can take as input any (non-empty) matrix and returns the vector of a product for every row, e.g. for the matrix
`[1, 3]`
`[2, 4]`
the function should return a numeric vector `(3, 8)`.

<!-- # BEGIN SOLUTION -->

```{r}
# BEGIN SOLUTION NO PROMPT
CountRowProds <- function(mat){
  return(apply(mat, 1, prod))
}
# END SOLUTION
# YOUR CODE HERE
# END PROMPT
```

<!-- # END SOLUTION -->

<!-- # BEGIN TESTS -->


```{r}
# HIDDEN
mat1 <- matrix(1:6, 3, 2)
mat2 <- matrix(1:6, 2, 3)
testthat::expect_true(all(CountRowProds(mat1) == c(4, 10, 18)))
testthat::expect_true(all(CountRowProds(mat2) == c(15, 48)))
```
